data.title: There is bug when run command line "cocos new"
data.body:
Just because i add "--no-native" when run cocos new, such as:

Shuangquan:cocos2d-x shuangquan$ source /Users/shuangquan/.bash_profile
Shuangquan:cocos2d-x shuangquan$ cocos new MyDemoGame --portrait --no-native -p com.demoproject.mydemogames -l lua -d /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/
执行命令：new

> 拷贝模板到 /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/MyDemoGame
> 替换文件中的工程名称，'HelloLua' 替换为 'MyDemoGame'。
> 拷贝引擎中的文件夹...
> 使用 re.sub() 修改文件内容。
> /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/MyDemoGame/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.ios_mac/ios/Info.plist 不是有效的文件。
> /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/MyDemoGame/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.ios_mac/ios/Info.plist 不是有效的文件。
> /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/MyDemoGame/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.android/AndroidManifest.xml 不是有效的文件。
> /Users/shuangquan/Documents/workspace/MyDemoGame/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.android-studio/app/AndroidManifest.xml 不是有效的文件。

data.title: why the label effect in cocos2dx can't be so clear ?
data.body:
I played a game called "梦幻西游" made by netease, and the effect of its label shocked me.
why its label can be so clear, while the effect in my game is so blurred ?

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

update libcococs2d name to v3.9 for WinRT platforms
data.body: This pull request updates the libcocos2d name to include v3.9 as needed by the Windows Store. This change applies to Windows 8.1 and 10.0 universal apps.

data.title: setGlobalZOrder on ui::Widgets has no effect.
android:sharedUserId on Manifest Causes Crash on Galaxy Edge+ and Note 5
data.body:
Hello

After very long hours of struggle I found out that Cocos2d-x Applications crash on Galaxy Edge+ and Note 5 if they have a android:sharedUserId value on the manifest and the value is same with the package name. I tried everything and I am desperate to find a solution. This issue doesn't occur with regular Android applications.

Recreating the issue is very simple. Create a new game with the latest version of cocos. And add a android:sharedUserId parameter to the <manifest> tag with a value same as the package game. Game will crash on Galaxy Edge+ or Note 5 at launch with this error: 

E/AndroidRuntime(31539): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.company.test/org.cocos2dx.cpp.AppActivity}: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: File res/drawable/edit_text.xml from drawable resource ID #0x1080016
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3149)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3257)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1000(ActivityThread.java:197)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1681)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:145)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6891)

E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1404)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1199)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539): Caused by: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: File res/drawable/edit_text.xml from drawable resource ID #0x1080016
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.content.res.Resources.loadDrawableForCookie(Resources.java:3984)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.content.res.Resources.loadDrawable(Resources.java:3852)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.content.res.TypedArray.getDrawable(TypedArray.java:776)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.view.View.<init>(View.java:4009)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.widget.TextView.<init>(TextView.java:1026)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.widget.EditText.<init>(EditText.java:88)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.widget.EditText.<init>(EditText.java:84)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.widget.EditText.<init>(EditText.java:80)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.widget.EditText.<init>(EditText.java:76)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxEditBox.<init>(Cocos2dxEditBox.java:110)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.init(Cocos2dxActivity.java:409)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at org.cocos2dx.lib.Cocos2dxActivity.onCreate(Cocos2dxActivity.java:310)

E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at org.cocos2dx.cpp.AppActivity.onCreate(AppActivity.java:346)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:6550)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1120)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3102)
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    ... 10 more
E/AndroidRuntime(31539): Caused by: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: File res/drawable-xhdpi-v4/textfield_default.9.png from drawable resource ID #0x108082f
E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.content.res.Resources.loadDrawableForCookie(Resources.java:3984)

E/AndroidRuntime(31539):    at android.content.res.TypedArray.getDrawable(TypedArray.java:776)

data.title: ccConfig.h CC_CONSTRUCTOR_ACCESS is public
data.body:
CC_CONSTRUCTOR_ACCESS comment says default is 'protected', as it should be given the create() paradigm. However the default value is 'public', and was changed to aid binding Sprite3D. Perhaps if Sprite3D is an edge case it should not use the macro?

https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/base/ccConfig.h

Last related change: f4b57511b080591ea39bd04d620f157b970676d6

data.title: No Lua Label aliasing
data.body:
I have a wrapper for TTF labels but setAliasTexParameters seems to be working differently now. 

``` lua
function label:ctor(text, font, size, halign, valign, anchor, animation)


    self.label_ = cc.Label:createWithTTF(text, font, size, cc.size(0,0), halign, valign)
                          :addTo(self)

    if anchor == nil then
        anchor = cc.p(0,1)
    end

    self.label_:setAnchorPoint(anchor)

--    self.label_:getTexture()
--               :setAliasTexParameters()

end
```

data.title: ControlColorPicker issue with setContentScaleFactor.
data.body:
If I set Director::getInstance()->setContentScalefactor() to support multiple screen size then color picker is wrongly placed.

PFA.
